text: I just dropped off a rickshaw passenger. I should be the one to win the solar film actually!

I remember reading an article from GIA Singapore  in an accident  claim from own insurance for repairs first. Thereafter dunno is it insurer or owner then file to claim the other party's. But then I thought usually drivers would claim opposite's for fear of penalty
But for chain collision  from what I gather
Front car will claim middle car
And middle car will claim last car
Ncd of middle car will be reduced even though not his fault
Why is it middle car not at fault?
And impact push middle car to knock front car
Actually is at fault  failure to keep safety distance
If you kept a safe distance and manage to NOT hit the front of the car in the event of sudden braking but then got rear ended and then hit the car in front  how?
And you can prove you kept a safe distance just that the front slammed on their brakes for whatever  cat run across the road..or rickshaw suddenly crash
